content.description: The furthest right climb and the shortest, climb nice low angle features to the top of the boulder. A large rock exists that can be used for a top rope anchor.
content.protection: A large boulder at the top can be slung for an anchor.

content.description: This is the furthest left climb on the cube and the hardest. Several powerful moves close to the ground lead to some easier 5.10 climbing higher. Start on a good right hand under cling and a left hand side pull and use interesting sloping pockets. I feel like these moves are around V6 or V7. Once you pull the problem good holds lead to a right trending ramp, head up left over the last steep section.
content.protection: Two bolt anchor, bring a #3 cam to put in a directional.
content.location: This climbs the longest part of the cube on a sort of prow.

content.description: This climb heads up a thin and techy face, if it were 100ft long, it would be excellent.
content.protection: A large boulder exists at the top which may be used for a top rope anchor.
content.location: this route starts on a clean face 4ft to the left of Sweetn’low, it climbs direct on small crimps and good edges

content.description: This route is a fun line that climbs direct to the bolts. It has some powerful moves and some good holds.
content.location: Start on the white jugs and move left and up following the weakness to the bolts.

pathTokens: Archangel Valley Sport and Traditional Climbing

content.description:
This fun little area isn’t worth a full day but if you’re up for another crag or just looking for a quiet day in a cool location this place might be for you.  

  The cube has a 4 routes or problems on it at the moment with potential for a few more.
